intro: Eremogone lancangensis, commonly known as the Lancang eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
